meanings.sent1: I feel sick and might barf after eating too much candy.
meanings.sent2: She barfed all over the floor when she got food poisoning.
meanings.sent3: The smell of the garbage made him want to barf.
meanings.sent4: The roller coaster was so intense, it felt like my stomach was going to barf out.
meanings.sent5: The disgusting sight made me want to barf immediately.

meanings.sent1: The dog barfed on the carpet, making a mess.
meanings.sent2: After the party, they had to clean up the barfed-up food.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally barfed on his friend's shoes during the car ride.
meanings.sent4: The overflowing toilet looked like it was about to barf its contents everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The baby barfed all over their new clothes.

meanings.sent1: Her sudden barf in class caused quite a commotion.
meanings.sent2: The smell of barf in the room made everyone feel queasy.
meanings.sent3: The sight of the barf on the sidewalk was enough to turn anyone's stomach.
meanings.sent4: The party ended early due to someone's unfortunate barf incident.
meanings.sent5: The bathroom reeked of barf after the stomach bug spread through the house.

meanings.definition: To regurgitate food from the stomach
meanings.sent1: The bird barfed up a pellet of undigested food.
meanings.sent2: He barfed out the food he had eaten too quickly.
meanings.sent3: The cat barfed up a hairball on the carpet.
meanings.sent4: The fish barfed out some food it couldn't digest properly.
meanings.sent5: The baby bird barfed up its meal for the parent to eat.
